subtitle: How can I feel less nauseous?
title: How can I feel less nauseous?
content:
Created by BabyCenter 

Feeling like vomiting? This is normal. Lots of women feel like this in pregnancy.

Everyone feels different. Some feel just a bit nauseous in the morning, and some find certain smells make them feel nauseous all day. Most women feel better by 3 months, but it could last longer. 

Try changing what you eat. Choose foods without much fat, and with no strong smell or taste. You could avoid spicy food, too. Some women find they can eat cold food but not hot food.

If you feel nauseous mostly in the mornings, it might help if you can eat a sweet potato, some roasted plantain (gonja), or a biscuit, before you get up. 

Also, try eating small meals, but more often, around 5-7 times a day.

Some ginger or lemon grated into a cup of tea or even just the smell of freshly grated ginger or lemon can help. You could also try chewing mints.

Explain to your family and friends how you are feeling and what you need. Do not feel guilty about asking for help with things like fetching water, digging, washing clothes, cooking and other chores.

Pregnancy sickness is normal, but if you are vomiting many times a day, if you are unable to eat and drink without vomiting, and if you are losing weight, you may need to go and see a health worker for treatment to help you.
